name: Acacia Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Acacia Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Acacia Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Acacia Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Acacia Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Acacia Leaves
description: Leaves are transparent natural blocks that generate as part of trees. They decay when not attached to a tree trunk, but persist when placed by a player.

name: Acacia Log
description: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs, with another one coming in the Winter Drop: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, pale oak​[upcoming JE 1.21.4 & BE 1.21.50], crimson, and warped.

name: Acacia Planks
description: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player crafts in Survival and Adventure modes. There are currently eleven variants of planks (and another one in an upcoming update), which can be differentiated into three categories: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

name: Acacia Pressure Plate
description: A wooden pressure plate is a wooden variant of the pressure plate. It can detect all entities, producing the maximum signal strength of 15. Wooden pressure plates come in all variants of wood.

name: Acacia Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Acacia Shelf
description: A shelf is a block that can store and display up to three stacks of items. A shelf can be used to swap its slots with the slots in the player's hotbar. It swaps 1 slot normally, and 3 slots at a time when powered with redstone.

name: Acacia Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Acacia Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Acacia Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Acacia Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Acacia Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Acacia Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Acacia Wood
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Activator Rail
description: An activator rail is a type of powerable rail that can eject players and mobs from regular minecarts, lock and unlock minecarts with hoppers and ignite minecarts with TNT.

name: Air
description: Air is an invisible block used to define empty space where other blocks could otherwise exist; it represents the negative or absence of a block. It is one of the few blocks in the game that players cannot normally interact with.

name: Allium
description: An allium is a flower that can be crafted into magenta dye.

name: Amethyst Cluster
description: Amethyst buds are the first three stages of growth of amethyst clusters, which grow on budding amethyst.

name: Ancient Debris
description: Ancient debris is a rare ore found in the Nether, and is the main source of netherite scraps, which can then be used to craft netherite ingots. Its high blast resistance makes it immune to normal explosions. In item form, it floats on lava and is completely immune to any form of fire.

name: Andesite
description: Andesite is a block of igneous rock, most often found in large pockets in the ground.

name: Andesite Slab
description: An andesite slab is an andesite variant of a slab.

name: Andesite Stairs
description: Andesite stairs are an andesite variant of the stairs.

name: Andesite Wall
description: An andesite wall is an andesite variant of a wall.

name: Anvil
description: Java Edition

name: Attached Melon Stem
description: Melon seeds are items obtained from melon slices that can be used to grow melon stems.

name: Attached Pumpkin Stem
description: Pumpkin seeds are items obtained from pumpkins that can be used to grow pumpkin stems.

name: Azalea
description: An azalea is a solid block that can be grown into an azalea tree.

name: Azalea Leaves
description: Leaves are transparent natural blocks that generate as part of trees. They decay when not attached to a tree trunk, but persist when placed by a player.

name: Azure Bluet
description: An azure bluet is a flower that can be crafted into light gray dye.

name: Bamboo
description: Bamboo is a versatile, fast-growing plant found primarily in jungles, used for crafting (particularly scaffolding and bamboo wood), smelting, and breeding pandas.

description: A bamboo mosaic is a decorative block crafted out of bamboo slabs.

name: Bamboo Mosaic Stairs

name: Bamboo Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Barrel
description: A barrel is a solid block used to store items. Unlike a chest, it cannot connect to other barrels. It also serves as a fisherman's job site block.

name: Barrier
description: A barrier is an invisible block used to create solid boundaries.

name: Basalt
description: Basalt (UD)

name: Beacon
description: A beacon is a block that projects a beam skyward, and can provide beneficial status effects to players in a radius around it when placed on top of a solid pyramid base constructed from iron, gold, diamond, emerald or netherite blocks.

name: Bedrock
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Bee Nest
description: A bee nest is a naturally occuring block that houses bees. They fill with honey as bees pollinate flowers and return to their homes and, when full, can either be sheared for honeycombs or honey bottles extracted using glass bottles.

name: Beehive
description: A beehive is a craftable block that houses bees. They fill with honey as bees pollinate flowers and return to their homes and, when full, can either be sheared for honeycombs or honey bottles extracted using glass bottles.

name: Beetroots
description: A beetroot is a food and dye ingredient.

name: Bell
description: Java Edition

name: Big Dripleaf
description: A big dripleaf is a plant that generates within lush caves. Its leaf is a temporary platform; when stood on, it tilts down and drops its burden, resetting a few seconds later.

name: Big Dripleaf Stem
description: A big dripleaf is a plant that generates within lush caves. Its leaf is a temporary platform; when stood on, it tilts down and drops its burden, resetting a few seconds later.

name: Black Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Black Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Black Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Black Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Black Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Black Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Black Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Black Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Black Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Black Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Black Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Black Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Black Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Blackstone
description: Blackstone is a dark-colored block that functions similar to cobblestone or cobbled deepslate. It can be found only in the Nether.

name: Blackstone Slab
description: Java Edition

name: Blackstone Stairs
description: Java Edition

name: Blackstone Wall
description: A blackstone wall is a blackstone variant of a wall.

name: Blast Furnace
description: A blast furnace is a block that smelts ores, raw metals and metal armor and tools twice as quickly as a furnace, but cannot smelt anything else. It also serves as an armorer's job site block.

name: Block of Amethyst
description: A block of amethyst is a block found in amethyst geodes or crafted from amethyst shards. It copies and 'repeats' vibrations received by adjacent sculk sensors.

name: Block of Bamboo
description: A block of bamboo is a log-like block made of bamboo that can be used to craft bamboo planks.

name: Block of Coal
description: A block of coal, also known as a coal block, is a storage block, equivalent to nine coal, that can also be used as fuel.

name: Block of Copper
description: A block of copper, internally known as a copper block, is a block that oxidizes over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidizing by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-oxidized, non-waxed blocks of copper are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.

name: Block of Diamond
description: A block of diamond, internally known as a diamond block, is a precious mineral block equivalent to nine diamonds.

name: Block of Emerald
description: A block of emerald, internally known as an emerald block, is a mineral block equivalent to nine emeralds.

name: Block of Gold
description: A block of gold, is a precious metal block equivalent to nine gold ingots.

name: Block of Iron
description: A block of iron, internally known as an iron block, is a precious metal block equivalent to nine iron ingots.

name: Block of Lapis Lazuli
description: A block of lapis lazuli, internally known as a lapis block, is a mineral block equivalent to nine pieces of lapis lazuli.

name: Block of Netherite
description: A block of netherite, internally known as a netherite block, is a precious metal block made from nine netherite ingots. Unlike most items, it is resistant to fire and lava, but still can be destroyed by cactus.

name: Block of Quartz
description: A block of quartz, internally known as a quartz block, is a mineral block used for decoration. It can be turned into a chiseled quartz block, quartz pillar, quartz bricks, or smooth quartz block.

name: Block of Raw Copper
description: A block of raw copper is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw copper.

name: Block of Raw Gold
description: A block of raw gold is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw gold.

name: Block of Raw Iron
description: A block of raw iron is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw iron.

name: Block of Redstone
description: A block of redstone, internally known as a redstone block, is a mineral block equivalent to nine redstone dust. It acts as a permanently powered redstone power source that can be pushed by pistons.

name: Block of Resin
description: A block of resin is a block equivalent to nine resin clumps.

name: Blue Orchid

name: Bookshelf

description: Budding amethyst is a fragile block found in amethyst geodes that grows amethyst clusters over time. It cannot be obtained as an item or moved by a piston, necessitating that it be returned to in order to harvest more clusters from it.

name: Bush
description: A bush is a non-solid plant block found in many grassy biomes. Its color is biome-dependent, and matches the color of grass blocks.

description: Java Edition

name: Cactus Flower
description: A cactus flower is a type of flower that grows from cacti. It can be placed on any solid top surface or crafted into pink dye.

description: A carrot is a food item obtained from carrot crops that can be used to plant them, eaten or used as a crafting ingredient.

name: Cartography Table
description: A cartography table is a utility block used for cloning, zooming out and locking maps. It also serves as a cartographer's job site block.

name: Carved Pumpkin
description: A carved pumpkin is a carved version of a pumpkin that can be worn or used to spawn golems. It can be made by using shears on a pumpkin placed in the world.

name: Cauldron
description: Java Edition

name: Cave Air
description: Air is an invisible block used to define empty space where other blocks could otherwise exist; it represents the negative or absence of a block. It is one of the few blocks in the game that players cannot normally interact with.

name: Cave Vines
description: Glow berries are a food item obtained from cave vines and can be used to plant them.

name: Chain
description: Chains are metallic decoration blocks.

name: Chain Command Block
description: A command block is a block that can execute commands. Because it cannot be obtained or used in Survival mode without cheats, it is primarily used on multiplayer servers, in Creative worlds, and custom maps.

name: Cherry Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Cherry Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Cherry Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Cherry Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Cherry Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Cherry Leaves
description: Leaves are transparent natural blocks that generate as part of trees. They decay when not attached to a tree trunk, but persist when placed by a player.

name: Cherry Log
description: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs, with another one coming in the Winter Drop: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, pale oak​[upcoming JE 1.21.4 & BE 1.21.50], crimson, and warped.

name: Cherry Planks
description: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player crafts in Survival and Adventure modes. There are currently eleven variants of planks (and another one in an upcoming update), which can be differentiated into three categories: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

name: Cherry Pressure Plate
description: A wooden pressure plate is a wooden variant of the pressure plate. It can detect all entities, producing the maximum signal strength of 15. Wooden pressure plates come in all variants of wood.

name: Cherry Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Cherry Shelf
description: A shelf is a block that can store and display up to three stacks of items. A shelf can be used to swap its slots with the slots in the player's hotbar. It swaps 1 slot normally, and 3 slots at a time when powered with redstone.

name: Cherry Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Cherry Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Cherry Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Cherry Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Cherry Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Cherry Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Cherry Wood
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Chest
description: A chest is a block used to store items.

name: Chipped Anvil
description: Java Edition

name: Chiseled Bookshelf
description: Chiseled bookshelves are blocks that can hold books, books and quills, written books, enchanted books and knowledge books.

name: Chiseled Copper
description: Chiseled copper is a variant of copper blocks that generates in trial chambers.[1]

name: Chiseled Deepslate
description: Chiseled deepslate is the chiseled version of deepslate.

name: Chiseled Nether Bricks
description: Chiseled nether bricks are a decorative variant of nether bricks, crafted from nether brick slabs.

name: Chiseled Polished Blackstone
description: Chiseled polished blackstone is the chiseled variation of polished blackstone.

name: Chiseled Quartz Block
description: A chiseled quartz block is a variant of the block of quartz that can be crafted from quartz slabs.

name: Chiseled Red Sandstone
description: Chiseled red sandstone is the chiseled variant of red sandstone, crafted from red sandstone slabs.

name: Chiseled Resin Bricks
description: Chiseled resin bricks are a variant of resin bricks, crafted from resin brick slabs.

name: Chiseled Sandstone
description: Chiseled sandstone is a decorative variant of sandstone, crafted from sandstone slabs.

name: Chiseled Stone Bricks
description: Chiseled stone bricks are a variant of stone bricks, crafted from stone brick slabs.

name: Chiseled Tuff
description: Chiseled tuff is a chiseled variant of tuff.

name: Chiseled Tuff Bricks
description: Chiseled tuff bricks are a variant of tuff bricks, featuring a large brick in the center of the block, with geometric design above and below.

name: Chorus Flower
description: Chorus flowers are blocks that grow on chorus plants found in the End. They can be planted on end stone, where they grow into new chorus plants.

name: Chorus Plant
description: Chorus plants are blocks that naturally generate on the outer islands of the End. They can be grown using chorus flowers.

name: Clay
description: Clay is a block that can be found abundantly in lush caves, in patches in shallow surface water or converted from mud using pointed dripstone. It can be smelted into terracotta or broken into clay balls which are smeltable into bricks.

name: Closed Eyeblossom
description: An eyeblossom is a unique flower found in the pale garden biome. It changes state depending on the daylight cycle, closing during the day and opening at night. Its "eye", visible only when the flower is open, glows in the dark but does not emit light in its surroundings.

name: Coal Ore
description: Coal ore is a mineral block that drops coal when mined.

name: Coarse Dirt
description: Coarse dirt is a variation of dirt on which grass block cannot spread.

name: Cobbled Deepslate
description: Cobbled deepslate is a stone variant that functions similar to cobblestone or blackstone.

name: Cobbled Deepslate Slab
description: A cobbled deepslate slab is a cobbled deepslate variant of a slab.

name: Cobbled Deepslate Stairs
description: Cobbled deepslate stairs are a cobbled deepslate variant of the stairs.

name: Cobbled Deepslate Wall
description: A cobbled deepslate wall is a cobbled deepslate variant of a wall.

name: Cobblestone
description: Cobblestone is a common block, obtained from mining stone. It is mainly used for crafting or as a building block.

name: Cobblestone Slab
description: A cobblestone slab is a cobblestone variant of a slab.

name: Cobblestone Stairs
description: Cobblestone stairs are a cobblestone variant of the stairs.

name: Cobblestone Wall
description: A cobblestone wall is a cobblestone variant of a wall.

name: Cobweb
description: A cobweb is a block that slows down entity movements.

name: Cocoa
description: Java Edition

name: Command Block
description: A command block is a block that can execute commands. Because it cannot be obtained or used in Survival mode without cheats, it is primarily used on multiplayer servers, in Creative worlds, and custom maps.

name: Composter
description: A composter is a block that converts some biological material into bone meal. It also serves as a farmer villager's job site block.

name: Conduit
description: A conduit is a beacon-like block that provides the Conduit Power effect and attacks monsters underwater.

name: Copper Bars
description: Copper bars are copper variants of bars. Unlike iron bars, they are colored copper orange and can oxidize over time, similar to other copper blocks.

name: Copper Bulb
description: A copper bulb is a light-emitting block. It toggles on or off when it receives a redstone pulse, and does not need continuous power to emit light. Its light level depends on its state of oxidation.

name: Copper Chain
description: Java Edition

name: Copper Chest
description: Single

name: Copper Door
description: A copper door is a type of door made of copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Copper Golem Statue
description: A copper golem statue is the result of a copper golem fully oxidizing and petrifying into a block. It can be posed in four different ways, or it can be reanimated by scraping it with an axe enough times.

name: Copper Grate
description: Copper grates are a variant of copper blocks that have perforations that can be seen through.

name: Copper Lantern
description: A copper lantern is a copper variant of a lantern that displays a green flame and oxidizes over time.

name: Copper Ore
description: Copper Ore

name: Copper Torch
description: A copper torch is a non-solid block that emits light. Copper torches can also be used to craft copper lanterns.

name: Copper Trapdoor
description: A copper trapdoor is a type of trapdoor made from copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Cornflower
description: A cornflower is a flower that can be crafted into blue dye.

name: Cracked Deepslate Bricks
description: Cracked deepslate bricks are the cracked variant of deepslate bricks.

name: Cracked Deepslate Tiles
description: Cracked deepslate tiles are a cracked variant of deepslate tiles.

name: Cracked Nether Bricks
description: Cracked nether bricks are a decorative variants of nether bricks, obtained by smelting.

name: Cracked Polished Blackstone Bricks
description: Cracked polished blackstone bricks is the cracked variant of polished blackstone bricks.

name: Cracked Stone Bricks
description: Cracked stone bricks are a variant of stone bricks, obtained through smelting and natural generation.

name: Crafter
description: A crafter is a low-capacity storage block used for automated crafting. Its inventory acts as a crafting table that crafts when it is powered, ejecting the crafted item (or items) from its "mouth" into the world or into a container it is facing. Its inventory slots can be individually locked to prevent hoppers, droppers, etc. from filling them; crafting recipes treat locked slots as empty of items.

name: Crafting Table
description: A crafting table is a utility block that gives access to all crafting recipes, including many not available from the inventory's crafting grid.

name: Creaking Heart
description: A creaking heart is a living block[1][2] that can be crafted or found in pale oak trees in pale gardens. It activates if placed in a line between two pale oak logs; then, during nighttime, it spawns a creaking and protects it from all damage. Breaking a creaking heart that is protecting...

name: Creeper Head
description: A creeper head is a block modeled after the head of a creeper.

name: Creeper Wall Head
description: A creeper head is a block modeled after the head of a creeper.

name: Crimson Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Crimson Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Crimson Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Crimson Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Crimson Fungus
description: A fungus is a mushroom-like block that generates in the Nether. There are two types of fungi: crimson and warped.

name: Crimson Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Crimson Hyphae
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Crimson Nylium
description: Nylium is a variant of netherrack that generates in the Nether. It has two variants: warped nylium and crimson nylium, each spawning in different biomes.

name: Crimson Planks
description: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player crafts in Survival and Adventure modes. There are currently eleven variants of planks (and another one in an upcoming update), which can be differentiated into three categories: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

name: Crimson Pressure Plate
description: A wooden pressure plate is a wooden variant of the pressure plate. It can detect all entities, producing the maximum signal strength of 15. Wooden pressure plates come in all variants of wood.

name: Crimson Roots
description: Crimson roots are a non-solid "plant" block that generate naturally on nylium and soul soil in few Nether biomes. They resemble a colony of tall, thin mushrooms.

name: Crimson Shelf
description: A shelf is a block that can store and display up to three stacks of items. A shelf can be used to swap its slots with the slots in the player's hotbar. It swaps 1 slot normally, and 3 slots at a time when powered with redstone.

name: Crimson Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Crimson Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Crimson Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Crimson Stem
description: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs, with another one coming in the Winter Drop: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, pale oak​[upcoming JE 1.21.4 & BE 1.21.50], crimson, and warped.

name: Crimson Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Crimson Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Crimson Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Crying Obsidian
description: Crying obsidian is a luminous variant of obsidian that can be used to craft a respawn anchor. Purple particles drip from its faces.

name: Cut Copper
description: Cut copper is an oxidizing metal block crafted from blocks of copper. Like other copper blocks, cut copper can be waxed to prevent oxidation.

name: Cut Copper Slab
description: A cut copper slab is a cut copper variant of a slab. Unlike other types of slabs, cut copper slabs can oxidize over time.

name: Cut Copper Stairs
description: Cut copper stairs are a cut copper variant of the stairs. Unlike other types of stairs, cut copper stairs can oxidize over time.

name: Cut Red Sandstone
description: Cut red sandstone is a variant of red sandstone, obtained through crafting.

name: Cut Red Sandstone Slab
description: A cut red sandstone slab is a cut red sandstone variant of a slab.

name: Cut Sandstone
description: Cut sandstone is a variant of sandstone, obtained through crafting.

name: Cut Sandstone Slab
description: A cut sandstone slab is a cut sandstone variant of a slab.

name: Cyan Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Cyan Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Cyan Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Cyan Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Cyan Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Cyan Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Cyan Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Cyan Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Cyan Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Cyan Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Cyan Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Cyan Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Cyan Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Damaged Anvil
description: Java Edition

name: Dandelion
description: A dandelion  is a flower that can be crafted into yellow dye and used to breed rabbits.

description: Dark prismarine is a dark cyan block, with a tight grid pattern; variant of prismarine.

name: Dark Prismarine Slab
description: A dark prismarine slab is a dark prismarine variant of a slab.

name: Dark Prismarine Stairs
description: Dark prismarine stairs are a dark prismarine variant of the stairs.

name: Daylight Detector
description: A daylight detector is a block that outputs a redstone signal based on sunlight.

name: Dead Brain Coral
description: A dead coral is a dead variant of coral. There are five variants total: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Dead Brain Coral Block
description: A dead coral block is a dead variant of a coral block. These blocks are always grey. There are five variants total: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Dead Brain Coral Fan
description: Dead coral fans are the result of the living variants of coral fans when they are outside water. There are five variants total: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Dead Brain Coral Wall Fan
description: Dead coral fans are the result of the living variants of coral fans when they are outside water. There are five variants total: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

description: A dead coral is a dead variant of coral. There are five variants total: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

description: Dead coral fans are the result of the living variants of coral fans when they are outside water. There are five variants total: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Dead Bush
description: Dead bushes are transparent blocks in the form of an aesthetic plant.

description: A dead coral is a dead variant of coral. There are five variants total: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Decorated Pot
description: A decorated pot is a storage block crafted from bricks and/or pottery sherds, with the items used individually affecting the appearance of its four side faces. It can store a single inventory slot's worth of items, which cannot be seen or retrieved by hand without breaking the pot.

name: Deepslate
description: Deepslate

name: Deepslate Brick Slab
description: A deepslate brick slab is a deepslate brick variant of a slab.

name: Deepslate Brick Stairs
description: Deepslate brick stairs are a deepslate brick variant of the stairs.

name: Deepslate Brick Wall
description: A deepslate brick wall is a deepslate brick variant of a wall.

name: Deepslate Bricks
description: Deepslate bricks are the brick version of deepslate.

name: Deepslate Coal Ore
description: Coal ore is a mineral block that drops coal when mined.

name: Deepslate Copper Ore
description: Copper Ore

name: Deepslate Diamond Ore
description: Diamond Ore

name: Deepslate Emerald Ore
description: Emerald ore is a rare mineral block that generates only in mountains and windswept hills biomes. It drops emeralds when mined, or itself if mined with a pickaxe with the Silk Touch enchantment.

name: Deepslate Gold Ore
description: Gold ore is a rare mineral block found underground that drops raw gold when mined with an iron pickaxe or better.

name: Deepslate Iron Ore
description: Iron ore is a mineral block typically found underground. It is a source of raw iron, which can be smelted into iron ingots.

name: Deepslate Lapis Lazuli Ore
description: Lapis lazuli ore, internally known as lapis ore, is the ore block from which lapis lazuli is obtained.

name: Deepslate Redstone Ore
description: Redstone ore is the ore block from which redstone is obtained.

name: Deepslate Tile Slab
description: A deepslate tile slab is a deepslate tile variant of a slab.

name: Deepslate Tile Stairs
description: Deepslate tile stairs are a deepslate tile variant of the stairs.

name: Deepslate Tile Wall
description: A deepslate tile wall is a deepslate tile variant of a wall.

name: Deepslate Tiles
description: Deepslate tiles are a decorative variant of deepslate.

name: Detector Rail
description: A detector rail is a type of rail that produces a redstone signal while a minecart is on it.

name: Diamond Ore
description: Diamond Ore

name: Diorite
description: Diorite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.

name: Diorite Slab
description: A diorite slab is a diorite variant of a slab.

name: Diorite Stairs
description: Diorite stairs are a diorite variant of the stairs.

name: Diorite Wall
description: A diorite wall is a diorite variant of a wall.

name: Dirt
description: Dirt is a block found abundantly in most biomes under a layer of grass blocks at the top of the Overworld.

name: Dirt Path
description: Dirt paths are decorative blocks. They are mainly found in villages as a path for the villagers.

name: Dispenser
description: A dispenser is a low-capacity storage block that can fire projectiles, use certain items or tools or place certain blocks, fluids or entities when given a redstone signal. Items that do not have unique dispenser functions are instead ejected into the world.

name: Dragon Egg
description: The dragon egg is a decorative block or a "trophy item", and is the rarest item obtainable in the game, as it generates only once (or twice in Bedrock Edition[1]) per world.

name: Dragon Head
description: A dragon head is a block modeled after the head of the ender dragon.

name: Dragon Wall Head
description: A dragon head is a block modeled after the head of the ender dragon.

name: Dried Ghast
description: A dried ghast is an immobile, shriveled, harmless ghast in the form of a block. It can be found near Nether fossils or obtained through bartering or crafting. Placing it in water will cause it to hydrate over time until it becomes a ghastling.

name: Dried Kelp Block
description: Dried kelp blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine dried kelp that can also be used as fuel.

name: Dripstone Block
description: The dripstone block is a rock block that allows pointed dripstone to grow beneath it.

name: Dropper
description: A dropper is a low-capacity storage block that can eject its contents into the world or into other containers when given a redstone signal.

name: Emerald Ore
description: Emerald ore is a rare mineral block that generates only in mountains and windswept hills biomes. It drops emeralds when mined, or itself if mined with a pickaxe with the Silk Touch enchantment.

name: Enchanting Table
description: Java Edition

name: End Gateway
description: End gateways are intradimensional portals generated in the End: some are spawned around the central island after each death of the ender dragon; others are randomly generated throughout the outer islands.

name: End Portal
description: Active

name: End Portal Frame
description: An end portal frame is a block that resembles end stone with a decorative bluish-green top, with sides decorated in hollow rounded rectangles with the same color as the top.

name: End Rod
description: An end rod is a decorative light source that emits white particles.

name: End Stone
description: End stone is a block that appears in the End and, apart from generated structures, makes up all of the solid ground that exists in that dimension.

name: End Stone Brick Slab
description: An end stone brick slab is an end stone brick variant of a slab.

name: End Stone Brick Stairs
description: End stone brick stairs are an end stone brick variant of the stairs.

name: End Stone Brick Wall
description: An end stone brick wall is an end stone brick variant of a wall.

name: End Stone Bricks
description: End stone bricks are an end stone-based brick.

name: Ender Chest
description: Ender chests are a type of chest whose contents are exclusive to each player, and they can be placed and accessed from anywhere in any dimension.

name: Exposed Chiseled Copper
description: Chiseled copper is a variant of copper blocks that generates in trial chambers.[1]

name: Exposed Copper
description: Copper is a material found in the Overworld. It spawns naturally in copper ore, which drops raw copper, which can then be smelted into copper ingots.

name: Exposed Copper Bars
description: Copper bars are copper variants of bars. Unlike iron bars, they are colored copper orange and can oxidize over time, similar to other copper blocks.

name: Exposed Copper Bulb
description: A copper bulb is a light-emitting block. It toggles on or off when it receives a redstone pulse, and does not need continuous power to emit light. Its light level depends on its state of oxidation.

name: Exposed Copper Chain
description: Java Edition

name: Exposed Copper Chest
description: Single

name: Exposed Copper Door
description: A copper door is a type of door made of copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Exposed Copper Golem Statue
description: A copper golem statue is the result of a copper golem fully oxidizing and petrifying into a block. It can be posed in four different ways, or it can be reanimated by scraping it with an axe enough times.

name: Exposed Copper Grate
description: Copper grates are a variant of copper blocks that have perforations that can be seen through.

name: Exposed Copper Lantern
description: A copper lantern is a copper variant of a lantern that displays a green flame and oxidizes over time.

name: Exposed Copper Trapdoor
description: A copper trapdoor is a type of trapdoor made from copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Exposed Cut Copper
description: Cut copper is an oxidizing metal block crafted from blocks of copper. Like other copper blocks, cut copper can be waxed to prevent oxidation.

name: Exposed Cut Copper Slab
description: A cut copper slab is a cut copper variant of a slab. Unlike other types of slabs, cut copper slabs can oxidize over time.

name: Exposed Cut Copper Stairs
description: Cut copper stairs are a cut copper variant of the stairs. Unlike other types of stairs, cut copper stairs can oxidize over time.

name: Exposed Lightning Rod
description: Java Edition

name: Farmland
description: Farmland is a block created by using a hoe on most types of dirt, and cannot be obtained in the inventory in Survival mode. It is required to grow all types of seeds, as well as carrots and potatoes.

name: Fern
description: Ferns are variants of short grass found only in certain biomes and have the same characteristics as grass.

name: Fire
description: Fire is a non-solid block that can spread to nearby flammable blocks and destroy them.

name: Fire Coral
description: Coral is a type of non-solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Fire Coral Block
description: A coral block is a solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Fire Coral Fan
description: Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Fire Coral Wall Fan
description: Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Firefly Bush
description: A firefly bush is a decorative plant that produces firefly particles around it when exposed to darkness.

name: Fletching Table
description: A fletching table is a fletcher's job site block that can generate naturally in villages. The fletching table is used to turn an unemployed villager into a fletcher.

name: Flower Pot
description: Java Edition

name: Flowering Azalea
description: A flowering azalea is a variant of azalea that, additionally, counts as a flower for all purposes, including pollination by bees, except crafting dyes.

name: Flowering Azalea Leaves
description: Leaves are transparent natural blocks that generate as part of trees. They decay when not attached to a tree trunk, but persist when placed by a player.

name: Frogspawn
description: Frogspawn is a non-solid block laid by frogs when they are bred, which hatches into tadpoles over time. It cannot be obtained as an item or moved by a piston.

name: Frosted Ice
description: Frosted ice is a translucent solid block created by the Frost Walker enchantment.

name: Furnace
description: A furnace is a utility block used for the smelting of blocks and items.

name: Gilded Blackstone
description: Gilded blackstone is a variant of blackstone found exclusively in bastion remnants, that can drop itself or gold nuggets when mined.

name: Glass
description: Glass is a transparent solid block that can be dyed into stained glass, or crafted into tinted glass.

name: Glass Pane
description: A glass pane is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to glass blocks. It can be dyed into stained glass panes.

name: Glow Lichen
description: A glow lichen is a non-solid, light-emitting block. It can generate, or be placed, on any side of a solid block.

name: Glowstone
description: Java Edition

name: Gold Ore
description: Gold ore is a rare mineral block found underground that drops raw gold when mined with an iron pickaxe or better.

name: Granite
description: Granite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.

name: Granite Slab
description: A granite slab is a granite variant of a slab.

name: Granite Stairs
description: Granite stairs are a granite variant of the stairs.

name: Granite Wall
description: A granite wall is a granite variant of a wall.

name: Grass Block
description: A grass block is a natural block that generates abundantly across the surface of the Overworld.

name: Gravel
description: Gravel is a gravity-affected block found in the Overworld and the Nether. It is a source of flint, which has a chance to drop when gravel is broken.

name: Gray Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Gray Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Gray Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Gray Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Gray Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Gray Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Gray Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Gray Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Gray Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Gray Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Gray Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Gray Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Gray Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Green Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Green Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Green Candle

name: Green Carpet

name: Green Concrete

name: Green Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Green Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Green Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Green Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Green Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Green Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Grindstone
description: A grindstone is a block that repairs tools, weapons, and armor, as well as removing enchantments from them, except for curses. It also serves as a weaponsmith's job site block.

name: Hanging Roots
description: Hanging roots are a natural decorative block found underground in the lush caves biome.

name: Hay Bale
description: Hay Bale (UD)

name: Heavy Core
description: A heavy core is a rare block that can be obtained from ominous vaults found in trial chambers. It can be combined with a breeze rod to craft a mace.

name: Heavy Weighted Pressure Plate
description: A heavy weighted pressure plate is a type of pressure plate that, like the light weighted pressure plate, outputs a variable redstone signal strength based on the number of entities present on the plate.

name: Honey Block
description: Honey blocks are storage blocks equivalent to four honey bottles. Honey blocks are sticky and can be used in conjunction with pistons to move blocks and adhered entities.

name: Honeycomb Block
description: Honeycomb blocks are decorative blocks crafted from honeycombs.

name: Hopper
description: Java Edition

name: Horn Coral
description: Coral is a type of non-solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Horn Coral Block
description: A coral block is a solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Horn Coral Fan
description: Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Horn Coral Wall Fan
description: Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Ice
description: Ice is a translucent solid block. It can slide entities using all methods of transportation (excluding minecarts).

name: Infested Chiseled Stone Bricks
description: Infested blocks are variants of stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks. They take less time to break and spawn silverfish when broken without Silk Touch. Silverfish hiding in infested blocks emerge when a nearby silverfish is attacked in order to attack the aggressor. Infested blocks cannot be obtained in item form.

name: Infested Cobblestone
description: Infested blocks are variants of stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks. They take less time to break and spawn silverfish when broken without Silk Touch. Silverfish hiding in infested blocks emerge when a nearby silverfish is attacked in order to attack the aggressor. Infested blocks cannot be obtained in item form.

name: Infested Cracked Stone Bricks
description: Infested blocks are variants of stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks. They take less time to break and spawn silverfish when broken without Silk Touch. Silverfish hiding in infested blocks emerge when a nearby silverfish is attacked in order to attack the aggressor. Infested blocks cannot be obtained in item form.

name: Infested Deepslate
description: Infested blocks are variants of stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks. They take less time to break and spawn silverfish when broken without Silk Touch. Silverfish hiding in infested blocks emerge when a nearby silverfish is attacked in order to attack the aggressor. Infested blocks cannot be obtained in item form.

name: Infested Mossy Stone Bricks
description: Infested blocks are variants of stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks. They take less time to break and spawn silverfish when broken without Silk Touch. Silverfish hiding in infested blocks emerge when a nearby silverfish is attacked in order to attack the aggressor. Infested blocks cannot be obtained in item form.

name: Infested Stone
description: Infested blocks are variants of stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks. They take less time to break and spawn silverfish when broken without Silk Touch. Silverfish hiding in infested blocks emerge when a nearby silverfish is attacked in order to attack the aggressor. Infested blocks cannot be obtained in item form.

name: Infested Stone Bricks
description: Infested blocks are variants of stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks. They take less time to break and spawn silverfish when broken without Silk Touch. Silverfish hiding in infested blocks emerge when a nearby silverfish is attacked in order to attack the aggressor. Infested blocks cannot be obtained in item form.

name: Iron Bars
description: Iron bars are blocks that serve a similar purpose to glass panes, but made of iron ingots instead of glass.

name: Iron Chain
description: Java Edition

name: Iron Door
description: An iron door is a variant of the door made of iron that can only be opened using redstone. Iron doors are more secure than wooden and copper doors because they cannot be opened by hand and cannot be broken by zombies. They are also more resistant to explosions, and immune to fire and lava.

name: Iron Ore
description: Iron ore is a mineral block typically found underground. It is a source of raw iron, which can be smelted into iron ingots.

name: Iron Trapdoor
description: An iron trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be only opened using redstone mechanisms.

name: Jack o'Lantern
description: Java Edition

name: Jigsaw Block
description: Jigsaw blocks are technical blocks commonly used as a way to construct large structures from smaller sections.

name: Jukebox
description: A jukebox is a block used to play music discs.

name: Jungle Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Jungle Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Jungle Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Jungle Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Jungle Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Jungle Leaves
description: Leaves are transparent natural blocks that generate as part of trees. They decay when not attached to a tree trunk, but persist when placed by a player.

name: Jungle Log
description: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs, with another one coming in the Winter Drop: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, pale oak​[upcoming JE 1.21.4 & BE 1.21.50], crimson, and warped.

name: Jungle Planks
description: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player crafts in Survival and Adventure modes. There are currently eleven variants of planks (and another one in an upcoming update), which can be differentiated into three categories: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

name: Jungle Pressure Plate
description: A wooden pressure plate is a wooden variant of the pressure plate. It can detect all entities, producing the maximum signal strength of 15. Wooden pressure plates come in all variants of wood.

name: Jungle Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Jungle Shelf
description: A shelf is a block that can store and display up to three stacks of items. A shelf can be used to swap its slots with the slots in the player's hotbar. It swaps 1 slot normally, and 3 slots at a time when powered with redstone.

name: Jungle Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Jungle Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Jungle Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Jungle Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Jungle Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Jungle Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Jungle Wood
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Kelp
description: Kelp is an underwater algae that generates in most oceans.

name: Kelp Plant
description: Kelp is an underwater algae that generates in most oceans.

name: Ladder
description: Ladders are solid blocks used for climbing walls either vertically or horizontally. They can be placed only on the sides of other blocks.

name: Lantern
description: Lanterns are blocks that emit light.

name: Lapis Lazuli Ore
description: Lapis lazuli ore, internally known as lapis ore, is the ore block from which lapis lazuli is obtained.

name: Large Amethyst Bud
description: Amethyst buds are the first three stages of growth of amethyst clusters, which grow on budding amethyst.

name: Large Fern
description: The large fern is the 2-block tall variant of the fern.

name: Lava
description: Lava is a light-emitting fluid that causes fire damage, mostly found in the lower reaches of the Overworld and the Nether.

name: Lava Cauldron
description: Java Edition

name: Leaf Litter
description: Leaf litter is a thin decorative block resembling fallen leaves. Up to four can be placed in the same block space.

name: Lectern
description: A lectern is a block from which written books can be displayed and read. It also serves as a librarian's job site block.

name: Lever
description: A lever is a non-solid block that can be switched to provide redstone power.

name: Light
description: Light (or lighting) in Minecraft affects visibility, mob spawning, and the growth of some plants. There are three aspects of Minecraft's lighting system: light level, internal light level, and rendered brightness.

name: Light Blue Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Light Blue Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Light Blue Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Light Blue Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Light Blue Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Light Blue Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Light Blue Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Light Blue Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Light Blue Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Light Blue Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Light Blue Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Lightning Rod
description: Java Edition

name: Lilac
description: A lilac is a tall flower that can be crafted into magenta dye.

name: Lily Pad
description: A lily pad is a short, flat solid block that can be found naturally growing only on water, in swamps and wheat farm rooms in woodland mansions.

name: Lily of the Valley
description: A lily of the valley is a flower that can be crafted into white dye.

name: Lime Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.
