description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Lime Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Lime Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Lime Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Lime Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Lodestone
description: A lodestone is a block that can be used to alter compasses to point toward it. It can be used in all three dimensions.

name: Loom
description: A loom is used to apply patterns to banners. It also serves as a shepherd's job site block.

name: Magenta Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Magenta Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Magenta Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Magenta Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Magenta Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Magenta Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Magenta Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Magenta Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Magenta Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Magenta Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Magenta Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Magenta Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Magenta Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Magma Block
description: A magma block is a light-emitting naturally-occurring block found in the Nether and the Overworld. It causes continuous damage while being stepped on, considered fire damage, except it does not light mobs on fire.

name: Mangrove Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Mangrove Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Mangrove Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Mangrove Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Mangrove Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Mangrove Leaves
description: Leaves are transparent natural blocks that generate as part of trees. They decay when not attached to a tree trunk, but persist when placed by a player.

name: Mangrove Log
description: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs, with another one coming in the Winter Drop: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, pale oak​[upcoming JE 1.21.4 & BE 1.21.50], crimson, and warped.

name: Mangrove Planks
description: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player crafts in Survival and Adventure modes. There are currently eleven variants of planks (and another one in an upcoming update), which can be differentiated into three categories: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

name: Mangrove Pressure Plate
description: A wooden pressure plate is a wooden variant of the pressure plate. It can detect all entities, producing the maximum signal strength of 15. Wooden pressure plates come in all variants of wood.

name: Mangrove Propagule
description: Propagule

name: Mangrove Roots
description: Mangrove roots are blocks that form as part of mangrove trees. Despite being a full block, they can be waterlogged.

name: Mangrove Shelf
description: A shelf is a block that can store and display up to three stacks of items. A shelf can be used to swap its slots with the slots in the player's hotbar. It swaps 1 slot normally, and 3 slots at a time when powered with redstone.

name: Mangrove Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Mangrove Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Mangrove Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Mangrove Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Mangrove Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Mangrove Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Mangrove Wood
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Medium Amethyst Bud
description: Amethyst buds are the first three stages of growth of amethyst clusters, which grow on budding amethyst.

name: Melon
description: A melon is a fruit block that grows from a fully-grown melon stem, which in turn is grown from melon seeds.

name: Melon Stem
description: Melon seeds are items obtained from melon slices that can be used to grow melon stems.

name: Monster Spawner
description: A spawner is cage-like block or entity that can spawn mobs. The term may refer to the following:

name: Moss Block
description: A moss block is a natural block that can be spread to other blocks by using bone meal.

name: Moss Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Mossy Cobblestone
description: Mossy cobblestone is a variant of cobblestone with moss on it. It is mainly used for crafting or as building block.

name: Mossy Cobblestone Slab
description: A mossy cobblestone slab is a mossy cobblestone variant of a slab.

name: Mossy Cobblestone Stairs
description: Mossy cobblestone stairs are a mossy cobblestone variant of the stairs.

name: Mossy Cobblestone Wall
description: A mossy cobblestone wall is a mossy cobblestone variant of a wall.

name: Mossy Stone Brick Slab
description: A mossy stone brick slab is a mossy stone brick variant of a slab.

name: Mossy Stone Brick Stairs
description: Mossy stone brick stairs are a mossy stone brick variant of the stairs.

name: Mossy Stone Brick Wall
description: A mossy stone brick wall is a mossy stone brick variant of a wall.

name: Mossy Stone Bricks
description: Mossy stone bricks are variant of stone bricks.

name: Moving Piston
description: Pistons and sticky pistons have 2 technical blocks that cannot be obtained. These include the piston head and moving piston blocks.

name: Mud
description: Mud is a block found abundantly in mangrove swamps or created by using a water bottle on any type of dirt block. It can be used for crafting or converted into clay using pointed dripstone.

name: Mud Brick Slab
description: A mud brick slab is a mud brick variant of a slab.

name: Mud Brick Stairs
description: Mud brick stairs are a mud brick variant of the stairs.

name: Mud Brick Wall
description: A mud brick wall is a mud brick variant of a wall.

name: Mud Bricks
description: Mud bricks are a block obtained by crafting 4 packed mud.

name: Muddy Mangrove Roots
description: Muddy mangrove roots are a decorative variant of mangrove roots with dirt-like properties.

name: Mushroom Stem
description: A mushroom block is a solid block that makes up a huge mushroom, which consists of a mushroom stem and brown mushroom blocks or red mushroom blocks, depending on the color of the huge mushroom.

name: Mycelium
description: Mycelium is a particularly rare variant of dirt that is found naturally only in mushroom fields biomes. It has a particle effect that resembles tiny spores being released constantly from the surface.

name: Nether Brick Fence
description: A nether brick fence is a nether brick variant of fences used to form nether fortresses in the Nether.

name: Nether Brick Slab
description: A nether brick slab is a nether brick variant of a slab.

name: Nether Brick Stairs
description: Nether brick stairs are a nether brick variant of the stairs.

name: Nether Brick Wall
description: A nether brick wall is a nether brick variant of a wall.

name: Nether Bricks
description: Nether bricks are the building blocks of nether fortresses in the Nether.

name: Nether Gold Ore
description: Nether gold ore is a variant of gold ore only found in the Nether.

name: Nether Portal
description: A nether portal is a manufactured structure that acts as a gateway between the Overworld and the Nether dimensions.

name: Nether Quartz Ore
description: Nether quartz ore is ore found in the Nether, and is a source of quartz.

name: Nether Sprouts
description: Nether sprouts are a non-solid fungi block that generate in warped forests. Unlike other warped forest plants, it does not have a crimson equivalent.

name: Nether Wart
description: Nether wart is a fungus harvested from nether wart crops and is used to plant them, as well as being vital in the creation of potions.

name: Nether Wart Block
description: Nether wart blocks are decorative blocks found in crimson forests and crafted using nether wart.

name: Netherrack
description: Netherrack is a frail stone block found abundantly in the Nether and in blobs below ruined portals. Fire lit on top of netherrack burns indefinitely and cannot be extinguished by rain.

name: Note Block
description: A note block is a block that emits sounds when attacked, used, or activated with redstone. The sound produced can be altered in various ways by using it or putting certain blocks directly above or below it. A note block's sound played repeatedly can be used to direct allays to stay nearby and drop collected items near it.

name: Oak Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Oak Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Oak Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Oak Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Oak Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Oak Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Oak Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Oak Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Oak Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Oak Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Oak Wood
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Observer
description: An observer is a block that emits a quick redstone pulse from its back when the block or fluid directly in front of its "face" experiences a change.

name: Obsidian
description: Obsidian is a block found naturally in all dimensions, and created when water flows over a lava source. It has high hardness and blast resistance, rendering it immune to normal explosions. Obsidian is used for crafting and to make the frame for a nether portal. It can only be obtained by mining it with a diamond or netherite pickaxe.

name: Ochre Froglight
description: A froglight is a light-emitting block that is obtained when a frog eats a tiny magma cube. It comes in three variants based on the variant of frog that eats the magma cube.

name: Open Eyeblossom
description: An eyeblossom is a unique flower found in the pale garden biome. It changes state depending on the daylight cycle, closing during the day and opening at night. Its "eye", visible only when the flower is open, glows in the dark but does not emit light in its surroundings.

name: Orange Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Orange Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Orange Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Orange Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Orange Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Orange Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Orange Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Orange Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Orange Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Orange Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Orange Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Orange Tulip
description: Tulips are a kind of flower found in plains and flower forests that come in multiple colored variants: red, orange, white, and pink. They yield dyes of their respective colors, with the exception of white tulips, which yield light gray dye.

name: Orange Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Orange Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Oxeye Daisy
description: An oxeye daisy is a flower that can be crafted into light gray dye and flower charge banner patterns.

name: Oxidized Chiseled Copper
description: Chiseled copper is a variant of copper blocks that generates in trial chambers.[1]

name: Oxidized Copper
description: Copper is a material found in the Overworld. It spawns naturally in copper ore, which drops raw copper, which can then be smelted into copper ingots.

name: Oxidized Copper Bars
description: Copper bars are copper variants of bars. Unlike iron bars, they are colored copper orange and can oxidize over time, similar to other copper blocks.

name: Oxidized Copper Bulb
description: A copper bulb is a light-emitting block. It toggles on or off when it receives a redstone pulse, and does not need continuous power to emit light. Its light level depends on its state of oxidation.

name: Oxidized Copper Chain
description: Java Edition

name: Oxidized Copper Chest
description: Single

name: Oxidized Copper Door
description: A copper door is a type of door made of copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Oxidized Copper Golem Statue
description: A copper golem statue is the result of a copper golem fully oxidizing and petrifying into a block. It can be posed in four different ways, or it can be reanimated by scraping it with an axe enough times.

name: Oxidized Copper Grate
description: Copper grates are a variant of copper blocks that have perforations that can be seen through.

name: Oxidized Copper Lantern
description: A copper lantern is a copper variant of a lantern that displays a green flame and oxidizes over time.

name: Oxidized Copper Trapdoor
description: A copper trapdoor is a type of trapdoor made from copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Oxidized Cut Copper
description: Cut copper is an oxidizing metal block crafted from blocks of copper. Like other copper blocks, cut copper can be waxed to prevent oxidation.

name: Oxidized Cut Copper Slab
description: A cut copper slab is a cut copper variant of a slab. Unlike other types of slabs, cut copper slabs can oxidize over time.

name: Oxidized Cut Copper Stairs
description: Cut copper stairs are a cut copper variant of the stairs. Unlike other types of stairs, cut copper stairs can oxidize over time.

name: Oxidized Lightning Rod
description: Java Edition

name: Packed Ice
description: Packed ice is an opaque, solid block variant of ice. Unlike regular ice, it does not melt near bright light sources.

name: Packed Mud
description: Packed mud is a block crafted from mud and wheat. It is used to create mud bricks.

name: Pale Hanging Moss
description: Pale hanging moss is a block found under the logs and leaves of pale oaks. When attached to a pale oak log or leaves, it emits ambient sounds.

name: Pale Moss Block
description: A pale moss block is a block that generates in pale gardens.

name: Pale Moss Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Peony
description: A peony is a tall flower that can be crafted into pink dye.

name: Petrified Oak Slab
description: A petrified oak slab, known as a wooden slab in Bedrock Edition, is a unique type of slab available through commands or by upgrading from legacy versions. Unlike all other slabs, they are unobtainable in vanilla Survival gameplay.

name: Piglin Head
description: A piglin head is a block modeled after the head of a piglin. It can be obtained when a piglin dies from a charged creeper's explosion.

name: Piglin Wall Head
description: A piglin head is a block modeled after the head of a piglin. It can be obtained when a piglin dies from a charged creeper's explosion.

description: Java Edition

name: Pitcher Crop
description: A pitcher pod is an ancient bulbous seed that has a chance to be dropped by sniffers when they finish digging. It is the seed of pitcher plants.

name: Pitcher Plant
description: A pitcher plant is a tall flower that grows from a pitcher pod.

name: Player Head
description: A player head is a block modeled after the head of a player (Steve by default). Player heads cannot be obtained in Survival.

name: Player Wall Head
description: A player head is a block modeled after the head of a player (Steve by default). Player heads cannot be obtained in Survival.

name: Podzol
description: Podzol is a dirt-type block that naturally blankets the surface of the old growth taiga and bamboo jungles, along with their respective variants. Grass blocks and mycelium cannot spread to this block.

name: Pointed Dripstone
description: Pointed dripstone is a block that makes up stalactites and stalagmites.

name: Polished Andesite
description: Polished andesite is the polished version of andesite.

name: Polished Andesite Slab
description: A polished andesite slab is a polished andesite variant of a slab.

name: Polished Andesite Stairs
description: Polished andesite stairs are a polished andesite variant of the stairs.

name: Polished Basalt
description: Polished Basalt (UD)

name: Polished Blackstone
description: Polished blackstone is the stone-like polished variation of blackstone.

name: Polished Blackstone Brick Slab
description: A polished blackstone brick slab is a polished blackstone brick variant of a slab.

name: Polished Blackstone Brick Stairs
description: Polished blackstone brick stairs are a polished blackstone brick variant of the stairs.

name: Polished Blackstone Brick Wall
description: A polished blackstone brick wall is a polished blackstone brick variant of a wall.

name: Polished Blackstone Bricks
description: Polished blackstone bricks are a decorative version of polished blackstone.

name: Polished Blackstone Button
description: A polished blackstone button is a variant of the button that shares many common properties with stone buttons. Like stone buttons, a polished blackstone button is a non-solid block that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed.

name: Polished Blackstone Pressure Plate
description: A polished blackstone pressure plate is a polished blackstone variant of the pressure plate that can detect only players and mobs.

name: Polished Blackstone Slab
description: A polished blackstone slab is a polished blackstone variant of a slab.

name: Polished Blackstone Stairs
description: Polished blackstone stairs are a polished blackstone variant of the stairs.

name: Polished Blackstone Wall
description: A polished blackstone wall is a polished blackstone variant of a wall.

name: Polished Deepslate
description: Polished deepslate is the stone-like polished version of deepslate.

name: Polished Deepslate Slab
description: A polished deepslate slab is a polished deepslate variant of a slab.

name: Polished Deepslate Stairs
description: Polished deepslate stairs are a polished deepslate variant of the stairs.

name: Polished Deepslate Wall
description: A polished deepslate wall is a polished deepslate variant of a wall.

name: Polished Diorite
description: Polished diorite is the polished version of diorite.

name: Polished Diorite Slab
description: A polished diorite slab is a polished diorite variant of a slab.

name: Polished Diorite Stairs
description: Polished diorite stairs are a polished diorite variant of the stairs.

name: Polished Granite
description: Polished granite is a processed and polished decorative form of granite.

name: Polished Granite Slab
description: A polished granite slab is a polished granite variant of a slab.

name: Polished Granite Stairs
description: Polished granite stairs are a polished granite variant of the stairs.

name: Polished Tuff
description: Polished tuff is a polished variant of the tuff block. Polished tuff's appearance matches to that of other polished rock materials, having two lighter edges and two darker edges on each face to mimic the appearance of a singular large and smoother stone.

name: Polished Tuff Slab
description: A polished tuff slab is a polished tuff variant of a slab.

name: Polished Tuff Stairs
description: Polished tuff stairs are a polished tuff variant of the stairs.

name: Polished Tuff Wall
description: A polished tuff wall is a polished tuff variant of a wall.

name: Poppy
description: A poppy is a red flower that can be crafted into red dye.

name: Potatoes
description: Java Crop

name: Potted Acacia Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Allium
description: An allium is a flower that can be crafted into magenta dye.

name: Potted Azure Bluet
description: An azure bluet is a flower that can be crafted into light gray dye.

name: Potted Bamboo
description: Bamboo is a versatile, fast-growing plant found primarily in jungles, used for crafting (particularly scaffolding and bamboo wood), smelting, and breeding pandas.

name: Potted Birch Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Blue Orchid
description: A blue orchid is a flower that generates exclusively in swamp biomes. It can be crafted into light blue dye.

name: Potted Brown Mushroom
description: A mushroom is a variety of fungus that grows and spreads in dark areas. Mushrooms generate as red or brown in color, and small or huge in size.

name: Potted Cactus
description: Java Edition

name: Potted Cherry Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Closed Eyeblossom
description: An eyeblossom is a unique flower found in the pale garden biome. It changes state depending on the daylight cycle, closing during the day and opening at night. Its "eye", visible only when the flower is open, glows in the dark but does not emit light in its surroundings.

name: Potted Cornflower
description: A cornflower is a flower that can be crafted into blue dye.

name: Potted Crimson Fungus
description: A fungus is a mushroom-like block that generates in the Nether. There are two types of fungi: crimson and warped.

name: Potted Crimson Roots
description: Crimson roots are a non-solid "plant" block that generate naturally on nylium and soul soil in few Nether biomes. They resemble a colony of tall, thin mushrooms.

name: Potted Dandelion
description: A dandelion  is a flower that can be crafted into yellow dye and used to breed rabbits.

name: Potted Dark Oak Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Dead Bush
description: Dead bushes are transparent blocks in the form of an aesthetic plant.

name: Potted Fern
description: Ferns are variants of short grass found only in certain biomes and have the same characteristics as grass.

name: Potted Jungle Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Lily of the Valley
description: A lily of the valley is a flower that can be crafted into white dye.

name: Potted Mangrove Propagule
description: Propagule

name: Potted Oak Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Open Eyeblossom
description: An eyeblossom is a unique flower found in the pale garden biome. It changes state depending on the daylight cycle, closing during the day and opening at night. Its "eye", visible only when the flower is open, glows in the dark but does not emit light in its surroundings.

name: Potted Orange Tulip
description: Tulips are a kind of flower found in plains and flower forests that come in multiple colored variants: red, orange, white, and pink. They yield dyes of their respective colors, with the exception of white tulips, which yield light gray dye.

name: Potted Oxeye Daisy
description: An oxeye daisy is a flower that can be crafted into light gray dye and flower charge banner patterns.

name: Potted Pale Oak Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Pink Tulip
description: Tulips are a kind of flower found in plains and flower forests that come in multiple colored variants: red, orange, white, and pink. They yield dyes of their respective colors, with the exception of white tulips, which yield light gray dye.

name: Potted Poppy
description: A poppy is a red flower that can be crafted into red dye.

name: Potted Red Mushroom
description: A mushroom is a variety of fungus that grows and spreads in dark areas. Mushrooms generate as red or brown in color, and small or huge in size.

name: Potted Red Tulip
description: Tulips are a kind of flower found in plains and flower forests that come in multiple colored variants: red, orange, white, and pink. They yield dyes of their respective colors, with the exception of white tulips, which yield light gray dye.

name: Potted Spruce Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Potted Torchflower
description: A torchflower is a flower obtained from harvesting torchflower seeds. It can be crafted into orange dye.

name: Potted Warped Fungus
description: A fungus is a mushroom-like block that generates in the Nether. There are two types of fungi: crimson and warped.

name: Potted Warped Roots
description: Warped roots are a non-solid "plant" block which generate naturally on warped nylium and soul soil in warped forests. They resemble a colony of tall, thin mushrooms.

name: Potted White Tulip
description: Tulips are a kind of flower found in plains and flower forests that come in multiple colored variants: red, orange, white, and pink. They yield dyes of their respective colors, with the exception of white tulips, which yield light gray dye.

name: Potted Wither Rose
description: A wither rose is a damaging flower that drops when a mob is killed by a wither.

name: Powder Snow
description: Powder snow is a block found in snowy slopes and grove biomes, in trial chambers, or collected from snowfall using cauldrons. Players and most mobs fall through powder snow and take freezing damage within it, but leather boots can be worn to stand on and climb through it as well as gain freezing immunity. Powder snow can only be obtained using a bucket.

name: Powder Snow Cauldron
description: Java Edition

name: Powered Rail
description: A powered rail is a type of rail that either increases or decreases the velocity of minecarts that move over it, depending on its power state.

name: Prismarine
description: Prismarine is a type of stone that appears underwater in ocean ruins and ocean monuments. It periodically changes color between blue and green.

name: Prismarine Brick Slab
description: A prismarine brick slab is a prismarine brick variant of a slab.

name: Prismarine Brick Stairs
description: Prismarine brick stairs are a prismarine brick variant of the stairs.

name: Prismarine Bricks
description: Prismarine bricks are a variant of prismarine, appearing as cyan bricks with chiseled patterns.

name: Prismarine Slab
description: A prismarine slab is a prismarine variant of a slab.

name: Prismarine Stairs
description: Prismarine stairs are a prismarine variant of the stairs.

name: Prismarine Wall
description: A prismarine wall is a prismarine variant of a wall.

name: Pumpkin
description: A pumpkin is a fruit block that appears in patches in grassy biomes. Pumpkins have the same texture on all 4 sides. The stalk on the top always points northwest (towards lower coordinates).

name: Pumpkin Stem
description: Pumpkin seeds are items obtained from pumpkins that can be used to grow pumpkin stems.

name: Purple Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Purple Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Purple Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Purple Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Purple Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Purple Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Purple Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Purple Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Purple Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Purple Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Purple Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Purple Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Purple Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Purpur Block
description: Purpur blocks are decorative blocks that can be crafted with popped chorus fruit and are naturally generated in end cities and end ships.

name: Purpur Pillar
description: Purpur Pillar (UD)

name: Purpur Slab
description: A purpur slab is a purpur variant of a slab that can be used to craft purpur pillars.

name: Purpur Stairs
description: Purpur stairs are a purpur variant of the stairs.

name: Quartz Bricks
description: Quartz bricks is the brick variant of the block of quartz, obtained through crafting.

name: Quartz Pillar
description: Quartz Pillar (UD)

name: Quartz Slab
description: A quartz slab is a quartz variant of a slab.

name: Quartz Stairs
description: Quartz stairs are a quartz variant of the stairs.

name: Rail
description: Rails are non-solid blocks that provide a path along which minecarts can travel.

name: Red Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Red Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: Red Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: Red Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: Red Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Red Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: Red Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: Red Mushroom
description: A mushroom is a variety of fungus that grows and spreads in dark areas. Mushrooms generate as red or brown in color, and small or huge in size.

name: Red Mushroom Block
description: A mushroom block is a solid block that makes up a huge mushroom, which consists of a mushroom stem and brown mushroom blocks or red mushroom blocks, depending on the color of the huge mushroom.

name: Red Nether Brick Slab
description: A red nether brick slab is a red nether brick variant of a slab.

name: Red Nether Brick Stairs
description: Red nether brick stairs are a red nether brick variant of the stairs.

name: Red Nether Brick Wall
description: A red nether brick wall is a red nether brick variant of a wall.

name: Red Nether Bricks
description: Red nether bricks are a decorative variant of nether bricks that do not naturally generate.

name: Red Sand
description: Red sand is a variation of sand found exclusively in the badlands.

name: Red Sandstone
description: Red sandstone is a variant of sandstone. Red sandstone comes in three other variants: cut red sandstone, chiseled red sandstone, and smooth red sandstone.

name: Red Sandstone Slab
description: A red sandstone slab is a red sandstone variant of a slab.

name: Red Sandstone Stairs
description: Red sandstone stairs are a red sandstone variant of the stairs.

name: Red Sandstone Wall
description: A red sandstone wall is a red sandstone variant of a wall.

name: Red Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Red Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: Red Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Red Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Red Tulip
description: Tulips are a kind of flower found in plains and flower forests that come in multiple colored variants: red, orange, white, and pink. They yield dyes of their respective colors, with the exception of white tulips, which yield light gray dye.

name: Red Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Red Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Redstone Comparator
description: A redstone comparator is a block that can produce a redstone signal from its front by reading chests, lecterns, beehives and similar blocks, or repeat a signal without changing its strength. It can also be set to either stop outputting a signal while its side input is receiving a stronger one (front torch off), or subtract its side input's signal strength from its output (front torch on).

name: Redstone Lamp
description: A redstone lamp is a solid block that produces light while it is receiving redstone power.

name: Redstone Ore
description: Redstone ore is the ore block from which redstone is obtained.

name: Redstone Repeater
description: Java Edition

name: Redstone Torch
description: Java Edition

name: Redstone Wall Torch
description: Java Edition

name: Redstone Wire
description: Redstone dust, internally known as redstone in item form, is a mineral that can transmit redstone power as a wire when placed as a block. It is also used in crafting, brewing and when trimming armor.

name: Reinforced Deepslate
description: Reinforced deepslate is a block that generates exclusively in ancient cities. It has high hardness, is immune to explosions, and cannot be obtained in Survival mode.

name: Repeating Command Block
description: A command block is a block that can execute commands. Because it cannot be obtained or used in Survival mode without cheats, it is primarily used on multiplayer servers, in Creative worlds, and custom maps.

name: Resin Brick Slab
description: A resin brick slab is a resin brick variant of a slab.

name: Resin Brick Stairs
description: Resin brick stairs are a resin brick variant of the stairs.

name: Resin Brick Wall
description: A resin brick wall is a resin brick variant of a wall.

name: Resin Bricks
description: Resin bricks is a block crafted from resin brick. It can also be crafted into its block family, containing slabs, stairs, walls and the chiseled variant.

name: Resin Clump
description: A resin clump is a block generated by the creaking heart, on pale oaks in the pale garden biome when the creaking is damaged. It can be used to craft decorative blocks of resin, and can also be smelted to produce resin bricks.

name: Respawn Anchor
description: A respawn anchor is a block that allows players to set their spawn point in the Nether.

name: Rooted Dirt
description: Rooted dirt is a natural decorative block.

name: Rose Bush
description: A rose bush is a tall flower that can be crafted into red dye.

name: Sand
description: Sand is a gravity-affected block found abundantly in deserts and beaches, and less commonly in or near surface water.

name: Sandstone
description: Sandstone is a solid block related to sand that comes in two color variants, the other being red sandstone. Regular sandstone is commonly found in deserts and beaches. Sandstone also has three decorative variants: chiseled sandstone, cut sandstone, and smooth sandstone.

name: Sandstone Slab
description: A sandstone slab is a sandstone variant of a slab.

name: Sandstone Stairs
description: Sandstone stairs are a sandstone variant of the stairs.

name: Sandstone Wall
description: A sandstone wall is a sandstone variant of a wall.

name: Scaffolding
description: Java Edition

name: Sculk
description: Sculk is a block found abundantly in the deep dark or converted from other blocks by a sculk catalyst. Like most of the rest of the sculk family, it drops experience when broken by a tool.

name: Sculk Catalyst
description: A sculk catalyst is a block that converts blocks around it to blocks in the sculk family (except for more sculk catalysts) when a mob or player that drops experience dies nearby.

name: Sculk Sensor
description: Java Edition

name: Sculk Shrieker
description: A sculk shrieker is a sculk block found in the deep dark that produces a "shrieking" noise when triggered. It can only be triggered by a player, either by standing on it (even while sneaking) or by triggering a nearby sculk sensor. Natural sculk shriekers also inflict Darkness and may summon a warden when triggered, but those placed by players or sculk catalysts are inert and unable to summon wardens or inflict Darkness under any circumstance.

name: Sculk Vein
description: A sculk vein is a block found in the deep dark or generated by sculk catalysts. It can generate or be placed on any side of a solid block.

name: Sea Lantern
description: A sea lantern is an underwater light source that appears in ocean monuments and ocean ruins.

name: Sea Pickle
description: A sea pickle is a small block that emits light underwater, and is typically found in colonies of up to four sea pickles.

name: Seagrass
description: Seagrass is a non-solid plant block that generates in all oceans, except frozen oceans.

name: Short Dry Grass
description: Short dry grass is a one-block tall foliage block that generates frequently in deserts and all types of badlands. It grows on sand and terracotta. It can also be eaten by sheep.

name: Short Grass
description: Short grass is a non-solid plant block that has wheat seeds as a drop. Its color is biome-dependent, and matches the color of grass blocks.

name: Shroomlight
description: Shroomlights are light-emitting blocks that generate in huge fungi.

name: Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: Skeleton Skull
description: A skeleton skull is a block modeled after the head of a skeleton.

name: Skeleton Wall Skull
description: A skeleton skull is a block modeled after the head of a skeleton.

name: Slime Block
description: A slime block is a storage block equivalent to nine slimeballs. It has both sticky and bouncy properties making it useful in conjunction with pistons to move both blocks and entities.

name: Small Amethyst Bud
description: Amethyst buds are the first three stages of growth of amethyst clusters, which grow on budding amethyst.

name: Small Dripleaf
description: Java Edition

name: Smithing Table
description: A smithing table is a utility block used to apply smithing templates to tools and armor. It also serves as a toolsmith's job site block.

name: Smoker
description: A smoker is a block that cooks food twice as quickly as a furnace, but cannot smelt anything else. It also serves as a butcher's job site block.

name: Smooth Basalt
description: Smooth basalt is an ornamental rock smelted from basalt or found as part of amethyst geodes and ancient cities.

name: Smooth Quartz Block
description: A smooth quartz block is a mineral block used only for decoration. It is made by smelting blocks of quartz.

name: Smooth Quartz Slab
description: A smooth quartz slab is a smooth quartz variant of a slab.

name: Smooth Quartz Stairs
description: Smooth quartz stairs are a smooth quartz variant of the stairs.

name: Smooth Red Sandstone
description: Smooth red sandstone is a variant of red sandstone, obtained by smelting.

name: Smooth Red Sandstone Slab
description: A smooth red sandstone slab is a smooth red sandstone variant of a slab.

name: Smooth Red Sandstone Stairs
description: Smooth red sandstone stairs are a smooth red sandstone variant of the stairs.

name: Smooth Sandstone
description: Smooth sandstone is a variant of sandstone, obtained by smelting.

name: Smooth Sandstone Slab
description: A smooth sandstone slab is a smooth sandstone variant of a slab.

name: Smooth Sandstone Stairs
description: Smooth sandstone stairs are a smooth sandstone variant of the stairs.

name: Smooth Stone
description: Smooth stone is a variant of stone made by smelting regular stone.

name: Smooth Stone Slab
description: A smooth stone slab is a smooth stone variant of a slab.

name: Sniffer Egg
description: A sniffer egg is a block that can be brushed out of suspicious sand in warm ocean ruins, or obtained by breeding two sniffers. It slowly hatches into a snifflet (baby sniffer) when placed.

name: Snow
description: Snow is a ground cover block found on the surface in snowy biomes, and can be replenished during snowfall.

name: Snow Block
description: A snow block is a full-sized block of snow.

name: Soul Campfire
description: Soul campfires are dimmer variants of campfires. Soul campfires deal more damage than normal campfires and have turquoise flames. Just like normal campfires, it can be used to cook food, pacify bees, act as a spread-proof light source, smoke signal or damaging trap block.

name: Soul Fire
description: Soul fire is a dimmer turquoise variation of fire that is created when soul sand or soul soil is ignited. Soul fire deals more damage than normal fire and does not spread.

name: Soul Lantern
description: Soul lanterns are blocks that emit light. They are a variant of the lantern crafted from soul torches.

name: Soul Sand
description: Soul sand is a block found naturally only in the Nether and ancient cities. Soul sand usually slows down the movement of mobs and players walking on it. It is also used for growing nether wart, crafting soul-related blocks, creating a bubble column, and constructing a wither.

name: Soul Soil
description: Soul soil is a block found abundantly in soul sand valleys. Unlike soul sand it does not slow down players or mobs that walk on it.

name: Soul Torch
description: Soul torches are non-solid blocks that emit light. They are a variant of the torch crafted with the addition of soul soil or soul sand.

name: Soul Wall Torch
description: Soul torches are non-solid blocks that emit light. They are a variant of the torch crafted with the addition of soul soil or soul sand.

name: Sponge
description: A sponge is a block that can be placed to remove water in an area around itself. This turns it into a wet sponge, which can be smelted or placed in the Nether to dry it to be reused. Sponges can only be found in ocean monuments.

name: Spore Blossom
description: Java Edition

name: Spruce Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Spruce Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Spruce Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Spruce Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Spruce Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Spruce Leaves
description: Leaves are transparent natural blocks that generate as part of trees. They decay when not attached to a tree trunk, but persist when placed by a player.

name: Spruce Log
description: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs, with another one coming in the Winter Drop: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, pale oak​[upcoming JE 1.21.4 & BE 1.21.50], crimson, and warped.

name: Spruce Planks
description: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player crafts in Survival and Adventure modes. There are currently eleven variants of planks (and another one in an upcoming update), which can be differentiated into three categories: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

name: Spruce Pressure Plate
description: A wooden pressure plate is a wooden variant of the pressure plate. It can detect all entities, producing the maximum signal strength of 15. Wooden pressure plates come in all variants of wood.

name: Spruce Sapling
description: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

name: Spruce Shelf
description: A shelf is a block that can store and display up to three stacks of items. A shelf can be used to swap its slots with the slots in the player's hotbar. It swaps 1 slot normally, and 3 slots at a time when powered with redstone.

name: Spruce Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Spruce Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Spruce Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Spruce Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Spruce Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Spruce Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Spruce Wood
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Sticky Piston
description: Java Edition

name: Stone
description: Stone is a block found underground in the Overworld or on the surface of mountains.

name: Stone Brick Slab
description: A stone brick slab is a stone brick variant of a slab.

name: Stone Brick Stairs
description: Stone brick stairs are a stone brick variant of the stairs.

name: Stone Brick Wall
description: A stone brick wall is a stone brick variant of a wall.

name: Stone Bricks
description: Stone bricks is a block found in various structures. It has three other variants, mossy stone bricks, cracked stone bricks, and chiseled stone bricks.

name: Stone Button
description: A stone button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal only when pressed by a player. Like other buttons, stone buttons are a non-solid block.

name: Stone Pressure Plate
description: A stone pressure plate is a stone variant of the pressure plate that can detect only players and mobs.

name: Stone Slab
description: A stone slab is a stone variant of a slab.

name: Stone Stairs
description: Stone stairs are a stone variant of the stairs.

name: Stonecutter
description: A stonecutter is a block used to efficiently craft many stone and copper blocks, and is cheaper than normal crafting for stairs and cut copper. It is also a job site block for mason villagers.

name: Stripped Acacia Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Acacia Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Birch Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Birch Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Cherry Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Cherry Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Crimson Hyphae
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Crimson Stem
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Dark Oak Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Dark Oak Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Jungle Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Jungle Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Mangrove Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Mangrove Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Oak Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Oak Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Pale Oak Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Pale Oak Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Spruce Log
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Spruce Wood
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Warped Hyphae
description: Java Edition

name: Stripped Warped Stem
description: Java Edition

name: Structure Block
description: A structure block is used to generate structures manually. They can also be used to save and load structures, alongside structure void blocks.

name: Structure Void
description: A structure void is an invisible block that allows existing blocks to remain unchanged rather than be overridden when using the structure block to load a structure.

name: Sugar Cane
description: Sugar cane is a plant block that generates near water. It is used to craft sugar and paper, making it an essential resource for making books, maps, and firework rockets.

name: Sunflower
description: A sunflower is a tall flower that generates exclusively in sunflower plains biomes. It can be crafted into yellow dye.

name: Suspicious Gravel
description: Suspicious gravel is a fragile gravity-affected block found in various Overworld structures. They can be brushed to extract structure-dependent loot, and are a source of pottery sherds alongside suspicious sand and trial chambers. Suspicious gravel drops nothing if broken, and break if they fall from any height or are moved with a piston.

name: Suspicious Sand
description: Suspicious sand is a fragile gravity-affected block found in various Overworld structures. They can be brushed to extract structure-dependent loot, and are a source of pottery sherds alongside suspicious gravel and trial chambers. Suspicious sand drops nothing if broken, and break if they fall from any height or are moved with a piston.

name: Sweet Berry Bush
description: Sweet berries are a food item obtained from sweet berry bushes and are used to plant them.

name: TNT
description: TNT is a block that can be activated by a redstone signal, flint and steel, stray fire, flaming projectile or explosion.

name: Tall Dry Grass
description: Tall dry grass is the tall variant of dry grass. Unlike other tall variants of foliage, this block is only one-block tall. It generates frequently in deserts and all types of badlands, and looks like a more full version of short dry grass. It also grows on sand and terracotta, and can be eaten by sheep...

name: Tall Grass
description: Tall grass is the 2-block tall variant of short grass.

name: Tall Seagrass
description: Seagrass is a non-solid plant block that generates in all oceans, except frozen oceans.

name: Target
description: A target is a block that produces a temporary redstone signal when hit by a projectile. Unlike most other conductive blocks, it also redirects adjacent redstone dust toward it.

name: Terracotta
description: Terracotta is a block that is found abundantly in badlands biomes, or can be obtained by smelting clay. It can be dyed to create stained terracotta.

name: Test Block
description: A test block is a technical block that is used for game tests.

name: Test Instance Block
description: A test instance block is a technical block that is used for game tests.

name: Tinted Glass
description: Tinted glass is a block that blocks light while being visually transparent.

name: Torch
description: Torches are non-solid blocks that emit light.

name: Torchflower
description: A torchflower is a flower obtained from harvesting torchflower seeds. It can be crafted into orange dye.

name: Torchflower Crop
description: Torchflower seeds are seeds that have a chance to be dropped by sniffers when they finish digging.

name: Trapped Chest
description: A trapped chest is a variant of the chest that functions similarly, but has a red-tinted latch, and produces redstone power while open.

name: Trial Spawner
description: A trial spawner is a type of spawner found only within trial chambers. It spawns mobs in waves, which increase in number the more Survival/Adventure mode players are nearby. When all of its spawned mobs are defeated, it ejects a combination of consumable items and/or trial keys, then goes inactive for 30 minutes. It cannot be obtained as an item or moved by a piston. A trial spawner converts into an ominous trial spawner during an ominous trial.

name: Tripwire
description: String is an item used in crafting recipes such as bows, fishing rods, and leads. When placed as a block, string becomes tripwire, which can be combined with tripwire hooks to form a tripwire circuit.

name: Tripwire Hook
description: A tripwire hook is a block used to create a tripwire circuit, which requires two hooks and a straight horizontal line of 1-40 string. Both hooks in a valid circuit emit a redstone signal and power their attached blocks while any of the string is being touched by an entity, or if any string is broken without using shears.

name: Tube Coral
description: Coral is a type of non-solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Tube Coral Block
description: A coral block is a solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Tube Coral Fan
description: Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Tube Coral Wall Fan
description: Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

name: Tuff
description: Tuff is an ornamental rock, occurring in underground ore blobs below Y=0.

name: Tuff Brick Slab
description: A tuff brick slab is a tuff brick variant of a slab.

name: Tuff Brick Stairs
description: Tuff brick stairs are a tuff brick variant of the stairs.

name: Tuff Brick Wall
description: A tuff brick wall is a tuff brick variant of a wall.

name: Tuff Bricks
description: Tuff bricks are a brick variant of tuff.

name: Tuff Slab
description: A tuff slab is a tuff variant of a slab.

name: Tuff Stairs
description: Tuff stairs are a tuff variant of the stairs.

name: Tuff Wall
description: A tuff wall is a tuff variant of a wall.

name: Turtle Egg
description: A turtle egg is a block containing 14 eggs that each hatch into a baby turtle.

name: Twisting Vines
description: Twisting vines are climbable upward-growing vegetation blocks found in the Nether in warped forests.

name: Vault
description: A vault is a block found in trial chambers. It dispenses loot when unlocked using a trial key. Each vault can be looted by an unlimited number of players, but each player can unlock a specific vault only once.[1]

name: Verdant Froglight
description: A froglight is a light-emitting block that is obtained when a frog eats a tiny magma cube. It comes in three variants based on the variant of frog that eats the magma cube.

name: Vines
description: Vines are climbable non-solid vegetation blocks that grow on walls.

name: Void Air
description: Air is an invisible block used to define empty space where other blocks could otherwise exist; it represents the negative or absence of a block. It is one of the few blocks in the game that players cannot normally interact with.

name: Wall Torch
description: Torches are non-solid blocks that emit light.

name: Warped Button
description: A wooden button is a variant of the button that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed. Wooden buttons come in every variation of wood, and all of them are non-solid blocks. They are activated either by a player interacting with the button or when hit by an arrow or trident. They remain pressed for longer than a stone button.

name: Warped Door
description: A wooden door is a variant of the door made of wood that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Warped Fence
description: A wooden fence is the wooden variant of fences, crafted using planks and sticks.

name: Warped Fence Gate
description: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

name: Warped Fungus
description: A fungus is a mushroom-like block that generates in the Nether. There are two types of fungi: crimson and warped.

name: Warped Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Warped Hyphae
description: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in ten (eleven​[upcoming]) types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry, crimson, warped, and  pale oak​[upcoming].

name: Warped Nylium
description: Nylium is a variant of netherrack that generates in the Nether. It has two variants: warped nylium and crimson nylium, each spawning in different biomes.

name: Warped Planks
description: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player crafts in Survival and Adventure modes. There are currently eleven variants of planks (and another one in an upcoming update), which can be differentiated into three categories: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

name: Warped Pressure Plate
description: A wooden pressure plate is a wooden variant of the pressure plate. It can detect all entities, producing the maximum signal strength of 15. Wooden pressure plates come in all variants of wood.

name: Warped Roots
description: Warped roots are a non-solid "plant" block which generate naturally on warped nylium and soul soil in warped forests. They resemble a colony of tall, thin mushrooms.

name: Warped Shelf
description: A shelf is a block that can store and display up to three stacks of items. A shelf can be used to swap its slots with the slots in the player's hotbar. It swaps 1 slot normally, and 3 slots at a time when powered with redstone.

name: Warped Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Warped Slab
description: A wooden slab is a wooden variant of a slab, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Warped Stairs
description: Wooden stairs are a wooden variant of the stairs, crafted from the respective planks.

name: Warped Stem
description: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs, with another one coming in the Winter Drop: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, pale oak​[upcoming JE 1.21.4 & BE 1.21.50], crimson, and warped.

name: Warped Trapdoor
description: A wooden trapdoor is a variant of the trapdoor that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Warped Wall Hanging Sign
description: A hanging sign is a variant of a  sign that displays text, and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of hanging signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent edits.

name: Warped Wall Sign
description: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text, and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. The text of signs can be customized with dyes and glow ink sacs, and they can be waxed to prevent its text from being edited by any player.

name: Warped Wart Block
description: Warped wart blocks are a decorative block found in warped forests, generating as part of huge warped fungus.

name: Water
description: Water is a fluid that naturally generates abundantly in the Overworld.

name: Water Cauldron
description: Java Edition

name: Waxed Block of Copper
description: A block of copper, internally known as a copper block, is a block that oxidizes over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidizing by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-oxidized, non-waxed blocks of copper are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.

name: Waxed Chiseled Copper
description: Chiseled copper is a variant of copper blocks that generates in trial chambers.[1]

name: Waxed Copper Bars
description: Copper bars are copper variants of bars. Unlike iron bars, they are colored copper orange and can oxidize over time, similar to other copper blocks.

name: Waxed Copper Bulb
description: A copper bulb is a light-emitting block. It toggles on or off when it receives a redstone pulse, and does not need continuous power to emit light. Its light level depends on its state of oxidation.

name: Waxed Copper Chain
description: Java Edition

name: Waxed Copper Chest
description: Single

name: Waxed Copper Door
description: A copper door is a type of door made of copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Waxed Copper Golem Statue
description: A copper golem statue is the result of a copper golem fully oxidizing and petrifying into a block. It can be posed in four different ways, or it can be reanimated by scraping it with an axe enough times.

name: Waxed Copper Grate
description: Copper grates are a variant of copper blocks that have perforations that can be seen through.

name: Waxed Copper Lantern
description: A copper lantern is a copper variant of a lantern that displays a green flame and oxidizes over time.

name: Waxed Copper Trapdoor
description: A copper trapdoor is a type of trapdoor made from copper that can be opened and closed by the player without redstone.

name: Waxed Cut Copper
description: Cut copper is an oxidizing metal block crafted from blocks of copper. Like other copper blocks, cut copper can be waxed to prevent oxidation.

name: Waxed Cut Copper Slab
description: A cut copper slab is a cut copper variant of a slab. Unlike other types of slabs, cut copper slabs can oxidize over time.

name: Waxed Cut Copper Stairs
description: Cut copper stairs are a cut copper variant of the stairs. Unlike other types of stairs, cut copper stairs can oxidize over time.

name: Waxed Exposed Chiseled Copper
description: Chiseled copper is a variant of copper blocks that generates in trial chambers.[1]

name: Waxed Exposed Copper
description: Copper is a material found in the Overworld. It spawns naturally in copper ore, which drops raw copper, which can then be smelted into copper ingots.

name: Waxed Exposed Copper Bars

description: Java Edition

name: Weathered Lightning Rod
description: Java Edition

name: Weeping Vines
description: Vines are climbable non-solid vegetation blocks that grow on walls.

name: Wet Sponge
description: A sponge is a block that can be placed to remove water in an area around itself. This turns it into a wet sponge, which can be smelted or placed in the Nether to dry it to be reused. Sponges can only be found in ocean monuments.

name: Wheat Crops
description: Wheat is an item primarily obtained by harvesting fully-grown wheat crops. It is used for crafting as well as to feed certain animals.

name: White Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: White Bed
description: A bed is a block that can be dyed. It allows a player to sleep and reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

name: White Candle
description: A candle is a block that emits light when lit with a flint and steel. It comes in the sixteen dye colors. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

name: White Carpet
description: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

name: White Concrete
description: Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: White Concrete Powder
description: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors.

name: White Glazed Terracotta
description: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the sixteen regular dye colors, obtained by smelting stained terracotta. Glazed terracotta does not stick to slime blocks or honey blocks, and it cannot be pulled by sticky pistons, but it can be pushed by pistons.

name: White Shulker Box
description: A shulker box is a dyeable block that stores items, and, unlike all other storage blocks, keeps its contents in item form when broken.

name: White Stained Glass
description: Stained glass is a dyed variant of the glass block.

name: White Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: White Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: White Tulip
description: Tulips are a kind of flower found in plains and flower forests that come in multiple colored variants: red, orange, white, and pink. They yield dyes of their respective colors, with the exception of white tulips, which yield light gray dye.

name: White Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: White Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Wildflowers
description: Wildflowers are a thin decorative flower that can be placed four times in the space of one block, similar to pink petals and leaf litter.

name: Wither Rose
description: A wither rose is a damaging flower that drops when a mob is killed by a wither.

name: Wither Skeleton Skull
description: A wither skeleton skull is a block modeled after the head of a wither skeleton, essential in the spawning of withers.

name: Wither Skeleton Wall Skull
description: A wither skeleton skull is a block modeled after the head of a wither skeleton, essential in the spawning of withers.

name: Yellow Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Yellow Bed

name: Yellow Stained Glass Pane
description: A stained glass pane is a dyed version of glass pane. It is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to stained glass blocks.

name: Yellow Terracotta
description: Stained terracotta[1] is a dyed variant of terracotta obtained by crafting undyed terracotta with dyes. Some of the variants are found in badlands biomes, and all variants can be smelted into glazed terracotta.

name: Yellow Wall Banner
description: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

name: Yellow Wool
description: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

name: Zombie Head
description: A zombie head is a block modeled after the head of a zombie.

name: Zombie Wall Head
description: A zombie head is a block modeled after the head of a zombie.
